diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Granulomatous meningoencephalitis caused by Acanthamoeba species
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient is a 62-year-old immunocompromised man experiencing rapidly progressive meningoencephalitis and uncontrollable cerebral edema. Although broad-spectrum antibiotics and antiviral therapies did not improve his condition, he had a history of sarcoidosis, and evidence of amebas was found at autopsy. The rapid progression of symptoms suggested an aggressive infection, particularly due to a protozoan. The definitive diagnosis was supported by the presence of Acanthamoeba in the brain at autopsy, leading to the conclusion of granulomatous meningoencephalitis.
